titles.title: Waiving provisions of the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1970 requiring adjournment of Congress by July 31.

action.text: Mr. Sensenbrenner asked unanimous consent to consider as introduced.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 7/31/1995--Introduced. Provides that notwithstanding provisions of the Legislative Reorganization Act of 1946 which require adjournment by July 31 of each year, the House of Representatives and the Senate shall not adjourn for a period in excess of three days, or adjourn sine die, until both Houses of Congress adopt a concurrent resolution providing for either such an adjournment.
